bibl.title: Letter from Benjamin C. Gruenberg to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 7, 1927

div1.p: Gruenberg asks to call on Reed so he can update her on the Kissinger relief fund.

div1.head: Letter from Benjamin C. Gruenberg to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 7, 1927
div1.opener:
TELEPHONE
MAIN 8980
380 ROOMS
FIREPROOF
THE BURLINGTON HOTEL
VERMONT AVENUE AT THOMAS CIRCLE
WASHINGTON,D.C.
7 May 1927
My dear Mrs Reed.
div1.p:
I am here until
tomorrow afternoon, and shld
be glad of an opportunity to see
you for a few minutes, and
report the progress of the
Kissinger Relief fund.
Will six o'clock suit you?
div1.closer:
Yours very truly Benj. C. Gruenberg
BENJAMIN C. GRUENBERG
AMERICAN ASSOCIATION
FOR MEDICAL PROGRESS, INC.
970 SEVENTH AVENUE
NEW YORK CITY
